required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Prospective Evaluation to Characterize the Real-World Performance of the EMBOVAC Aspiration Catheter
clinical_study.official_title: Prospective Evaluation to Characterize the Real-World Performance of the EMBOVAC Aspiration Catheter for Neurothrombectomy: A Post-Market Clinical Follow-up Trial.

lead_sponsor.agency: Cerenovus, Part of DePuy Synthes Products, Inc.

clinical_study.source: Cerenovus, Part of DePuy Synthes Products, Inc.

brief_summary.textblock: A post-market study evaluating the EMBOVAC Aspiration Catheter in acute ischemic stroke patients with confirmed intracranial large vessel occlusion.

detailed_description.textblock:
The PERFECT Study is a prospective, multi-center, single arm, post-market clinical follow-up study.
The objective of this post-market clinical follow-up study is to assess the performance of the EMBOVAC Aspiration Catheter in the treatment of acute ischemic stroke in a real-world clinical setting.
The study will also report on clot characteristics and clinical outcomes.

intervention.description: The EMBOVAC Aspiration catheter is used to treat acute ischemic stroke. . The catheter can be used to facilitate introduction of diagnostic or therapeutic agents and is also intended for use in removal/aspiration of emboli and thrombi from selected blood vessels in the neuro vasculature.

study_pop.textblock: Acute Ischemic Stroke patients with confirmed intracranial large vessel occlusion.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Subject ≥ 18 years old.
2. Subject experiencing acute ischemic stroke with angiographic confirmation of Large Vessel Occlusion of the distal intracranial internal carotid artery, middle cerebral artery or anterior cerebral artery.
3. A clinical decision has been made to use the EmboVac™ aspiration catheter prior to enrollment in the research.
4. EmboVac™ Aspiration Catheter is used for the first 3 clot removal passes for the target intracranial occlusion
5. Pre-stroke mRS ≤ 1
6. NIHSS ≤ 30
7. Subject or subject's legally authorized representative has signed and dated an Informed Consent Form.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Potential study candidate has already undergone standard of care assessments or treatment that deviate from the clinical research protocol requirements.
2. All patients with severe hypertension on presentation. All patients, in whom intravenous therapy with blood pressure medications is indicated, with hypertension that remains severe and sustained despite intravenous antihypertensive therapy.
3. Known cerebral vasculitis.
4. Known cancer with life expectancy less than 12 months
5. Stenosis, or any occlusion, in a proximal vessel that requires treatment or prevents access to the site of occlusion
6. Intracranial stenosis that prevents access to the site of occlusion.
7. Computed tomography (CT) or Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) evidence of recent/ fresh hemorrhage on presentation.
8. Baseline computed tomography (CT) or MRI showing mass effect or intracranial tumor (except small meningioma).
9. Evidence of dissection in the extra or intracranial cerebral arteries.
10. Occlusions in multiple vascular territories.
11. Confirmation of positive pregnancy test according to site specific standard of care.
12. Currently participating in an investigational clinical trial that may confound study endpoints.
